Instrument.name: The Gamma Ray Spectrometer (GRS) for NEAR Shoemaker
Instrument.description: The Gamma Ray Spectrometer (GRS) was part of the X-Ray/Gamma-Ray Spectrometer (XGRS) suite on the NEAR Shoemaker mission. It detected characteristic gamma rays in the 0.3- to 10-MeV range emitted from specific elements in the surface. The GRS used a body-mounted passively cooled NaI scintillator detector with a bismuth germanate anticoincidence shield that defined a 45 degree FOV, with an objective of measuring abundances of several important elements such as K, Si, and Fe in four quadrants of the target asteroid.
